title: PHPExceptiongetFile() Method

metadata.description: Learn about PHPExceptiongetFile() Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Throw an exception and output the path of the file in which the exception
occurred:
<?php
try {
throw new Exception("An error occurred");
} 
  catch(Exception $e) {
echo "Error in this file: " . $e->getFile();
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
getFile()
method returns the absolute path to the file where an exception occurred.
Syntax
$exception->getFile()
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns a string
Related Pages
Read more about Exceptions in our
PHP Exceptions Chapter
.
